results.title: Evidence for simvastatin anti-inflammatory actions based on quantitative analyses of NETosis and other inflammation/oxidation markers.
results.text_hl: To test this hypothesis, we compared untreated @<m>DISEASE_Somatosensory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020886 @@@thermal injury@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Somatosensory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020886 @@@TI@@@) adult male @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Somatosensory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020886 @@@TI@@@ littermates treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (0.2 mg/kg i.p., @<m>DISEASE_Somatosensory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020886 @@@TI@@@ + @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SMV@@@) immediately following @DISEASE_Burns @DISEASE_MESH:D002056 @@@burn injury@@@ and two hours before being sacrificed the day after; @CHEMICAL_Melatonin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008550 @@@melatonin@@@-treated (Mel) (1.86 mg/kg i.p., @<m>DISEASE_Somatosensory_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020886 @@@TI@@@ + Mel) @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ were compared as a positive control.

citations.NLM: Al-Ghoul WM, Kim MS, Fazal N, Azim AC, Ali A. Evidence for simvastatin anti-inflammatory actions based on quantitative analyses of NETosis and other inflammation/oxidation markers. Results Immunol. 2014;4():14-22. PMID: 24809006
